p: The ionic composition of the water is dominated by bicarbonate anions (about 27%, 2.55 mval/L) and calcium cations (29%, 2.7 mval/L) ( Figure 1). The water of the sedimentation tank is characterized by an average value of electrolytic conductivity of 360 μS/cm and neutral (pH~7) pH. A characteristic feature of the water is the trace amounts of biogenic substances—nitrogen and phosphorus. The average concentration of nitrates (NO 3 −) was only 1.5 mg/L and the concentration of phosphates (PO 4 2−) was below the limit to be quantified.
